questiontext.text:
Fourth quadrant \( (270^\circ\le\theta\le 360^\circ) \)

The figures below illustrate how \(\cos \theta\) and \(\sin \theta\) change for \(\theta\) in the fourth quadrant.

\(\theta = 270^\circ\), we find that \(\cos 270^\circ = 0\) and \(\sin 270^\circ = -1\).

\(270^\circ < \theta <360^\circ\)  (or alternatively \(-90^\circ <\theta < 0\). Then \(\cos \theta = OQ > 0\) and \(\sin\theta = OR < 0\)

\(\theta = 360^\circ\). This is the same as \(\theta = 0\), so \(\cos 360^\circ = 1\) and \(\sin 360^\circ = 0\).


From the figures above the results in the Key Point should be clear.

Key Point

\(\cos(-x)\equiv\cos x \qquad\quad \sin(-x)\equiv-\sin x\qquad\quad\tan (-x)\equiv-\tan x\)
